etymologies: late Middle English (denoting a narrow hanging section of a decoratively slashed garment): of unknown origin; compare with dag. The verb dates from the early 17th century

definitions: a label attached to someone or something for the purpose of identification or to give other information

examples.text: he gave his pet a collar with a metal name tag
he took off his identity tag and inserted it into a machine

shortDefinitions: label attached to person or thing for identification

definitions: an electronic device that can be attached to someone or something for monitoring purposes, e.g., to deter shoplifters.
shortDefinitions: electronic device for monitoring person or thing

definitions: a nickname or description popularly given to someone or something

examples.text: he lived up to his tag as the team's savior

shortDefinitions: nickname or description

definitions: a nickname or other identifying mark written as the signature of a graffiti artist

examples.text: scrawled felt-tip tags on city walls

shortDefinitions: signature of graffiti artist

definitions: an instruction appended to a piece of text in a markup language in order to specify how it is displayed or interpreted.
shortDefinitions: instruction appended to text in markup language

definitions: a word, phrase, or name used to identify digital content such as blog and social media posts as belonging to a particular category or concerning a particular person or topic

examples.text: you can easily add tags to photos en masse

shortDefinitions: word used to identify digital content

definitions: the license plate of a motor vehicle

examples.text: the car had Texas tags

shortDefinitions: licence plate of motor vehicle

definitions: a small piece or part that is attached to a main body.
shortDefinitions: small piece or part that is attached to main body

definitions: a ragged lock of wool on a sheep.
shortDefinitions: ragged lock of wool on sheep

definitions: the tip of an animal's tail when it is distinctively colored.
shortDefinitions: tip of animal's tail when it is distinctively coloured

definitions: a loose or spare end of something; a leftover

examples.text: I have a few tags of second-hand equipment

shortDefinitions: loose or spare end of something

definitions: a metal or plastic point at the end of a shoelace that stiffens it, making it easier to insert through an eyelet.
shortDefinitions: metal or plastic point at end of shoelace

definitions: a frequently repeated quotation or stock phrase

examples.text: his writing is full of tags from the Bible and Shakespeare

shortDefinitions: frequently repeated quotation or stock phrase

definitions: (in drama) a closing speech addressed to the audience.
shortDefinitions: closing speech addressed to audience

definitions: a refrain or musical phrase in a song or piece of music.
shortDefinitions: refrain or musical phrase in song or piece of music

definitions: a short phrase or clause added to an already complete sentence, as in I like it, I do.
shortDefinitions: short phrase or clause added to already complete sentence

definitions: attach a label to

examples.text: the bears were tagged and released

shortDefinitions: attach label to

definitions: attach a monitoring tag to

examples.text: we have to tag the sheep before sale or when moving them from one farm to another

shortDefinitions: attach monitoring tag to

definitions: give a specified name or description to

examples.text: he left because he didn't want to be tagged as a soap star

notes.text: with object and adverbial or complement

shortDefinitions: give name or description to

definitions: (of a graffiti artist) write one's nickname or mark on (a surface)

examples.text: storefronts are shuttered with metal roll-down barricades tagged with graffiti

shortDefinitions: write one's nickname or mark on

definitions: add an instruction to (a piece of text in a markup language) in order to specify how it is displayed or interpreted.
shortDefinitions: add instruction to piece of text

definitions: add a word, phrase, or name to (digital content) to identify it as belonging to a particular category or concerning a particular person or topic

examples.text: I will be tagged in every photo I post

shortDefinitions: add word to identify digital content

definitions: label (something) with a radioactive isotope, fluorescent dye, or other marker

examples.text: pieces of DNA tagged with radioactive particles

shortDefinitions: label something with radioactive isotope, fluorescent dye

definitions: add to something, especially as an afterthought or with no real connection

examples.text: she meant to tag her question on at the end of her remarks

shortDefinitions: add to something

definitions: follow or accompany someone, especially without invitation

examples.text: that'll teach you not to tag along where you're not wanted

shortDefinitions: follow someone

definitions: shear away ragged locks of wool from (sheep).
shortDefinitions: shear away ragged locks of wool from

etymologies: mid 18th century: perhaps a variant of tig

definitions: a children's game in which one child chases the others and anyone who is touched then becomes the pursuer

examples.text: we began to play tag under the water

shortDefinitions: children's game in which one child chases others

definitions: the action of tagging out a runner or tagging a base

examples.text: he narrowly avoided a sweeping tag by the first baseman

shortDefinitions: action of tagging runner

definitions: denoting a form of wrestling involving tag teams.
shortDefinitions: denoting form of wrestling involving tag teams

definitions: touch (someone being chased) in a game of tag.
shortDefinitions: touch someone being chased in game of tag

definitions: put out (a runner) by touching them with the ball or with the glove holding the ball

examples.text: catching their fastest runner in a rundown and tagging him out

shortDefinitions: put runner out by touching with ball or with hand holding ball

definitions: (of a base runner, or a fielder with the ball) touch (a base) with the foot

examples.text: the short center fielder could field the ball and tag second base for a force out

shortDefinitions: (of base runner, or fielder with ball) touch base with foot

definitions: (of a base runner) touch the base one has occupied after a fly ball is caught, before running to the next base

examples.text: when the ball was hit, he went back to the bag to tag up

shortDefinitions: (of base runner) touch base one has occupied after fly ball is caught, before running to next base
